predicate.note: Frames file for 'dilute' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No Verbnet entry. Comparison with 'weaken'.

roleset.name: water down, make weaker

example.name: just transitive
example.text: Mr. Hahn said Georgia-Pacific has accounted in its strategy for a ``significant downturn'' in the pulp and paper industry, an event that he said *trace* would temporarily dilute earnings.

example.name: with extent
example.text: William O. McCoy, president of the company's BellSouth Enterprises Inc. unit, said the revised agreement with LIN would dilute BellSouth earnings by about 9% in both 1990 and 1991.

roleset.note: There's some financial usage of "fully diluted stocks" which I don't understand, but which is clearly adjectival and thus can be ignored.

example.name: with instrument
example.text: John diluted the perfectly aged Bordeaux with Mad Dog.
